Each character has a special skill that charges up as they use that character. When this skill is charged up and this character is not being used, this icon will appear next to their name.
Mission player is trying to complete. Gives players a breakdown of the task and other supporting information (how far they are from the area, how much time they hv left, etc). Affects 1b and 1c.

After completing an area, players get to enter a rest room. If players manage to complete certain goals (eg. clear the previous area in less than 2 mins), they get extra rewards.

Path to the waypoint indicated by Line.

Name of enemy

The game can sometimes automatically do skill checks for the player. The player won't know how close / far they are to succeeding in the roll, just the results.

The dice the player will be using (d20, d100, etc).
Any actions that players want to do (that can affect the story) has a chance to success or fail. To do the action, they have to succeed rolling a number higher than the given difficulty class.
If the d20 gets a value above the difficulty class, the action succeeded.
Red when it fails.

data.data_value: Long Notes (need to be held until the next note in the sequence)

notes: Based on the specific fret colour (i.e. yellow in this case).
A coloured line that connected the first note with the subsequent note.
Countdown from 3 till the race starts
A count of how much coins the player has (out of 10, the more coins you have, you gain a slight speed boost) and what lap of the race you're on.
The Rock Meter indicates performance status with colours; green is good, yellow is okay, and red is bad.
Each multiply value (i.e. 2x, 3x, 4x) has its own colour value: 2X is orange, 3x is green, 4x is purple, 8x is bright green. Fills up the rectangle as you hit correct notes. Maxes out at 4x.

Green line means they stayed in the standings.
Blue down arrow means they moved down in the standings.

Scores for both teams, what team they are shown through name acronym and logo image (lakers vs mavericks), how many timeouts each team has, how many fouls they committed in the game, what quarter in the game we're at, what time we're at, and shotclock timer
Red circle under the player but this is customizable
Star symbol used to indicate a high-rated player at this position.
Red circle under the player but this is customizable
Star symbol used to indicate a high-rated player at this position.
How much stamina they have left, used for sprinting. Once its out, the player will stop running. Yellow when relatively full, becomes red when its low.
Which ways the player can throw the ball to
Red means can't pass / shoot there (risk getting blocked)
Green means can pass / shoot
How much stamina they have left, used for sprinting. Once its out, the player will stop running.
Yellow when relatively full, becomes red when its low.
It's a timing thing, have to click the key when the arrow is at the given slot.
Top arrow length fill decreases with time as the bottom arrow moves up and aligns with it.
Green indicates a successful shot.
Shows up when there's something the player can do. It's a choice, each icon does a different thing.
Action will only be executed once the radial bar fully fills the icon.
Y position of the text alerts are based on how recent someone connected to the server
Health grows clockwise, and a luminance is darker for missing health.
Armour grows clockwise, and a luminance is darker for missing armour.
Energy grows counter clockwise and a luminance is darker for missing stamina.

Other vitals are much smaller because they aren't as important for quick decisions. Strength is the only one that has text for the level of strength that can increase over the course of the game. Everything else is a fixed ratio.
General position data, where in map
Position indicates Recency.
Red indicates unfinished objectives.
Position indicates Recency
Red: Inventory full

In general red indicates a negative or something is full, whereas white is a tip.

notes: Bar length only appears for food consumable items with a spoil time.
Illuminated box background shows what is currently being selected or hovered.
Tells players what key to click to select it.
There's also the illustration of the item (stone hatchet).
Selected menu has a brighter luminance
Text over Engrams represents amount of Engram points the player has
The white gradient overlay on top of the Engram box.
Tells players what key to click to select it.
Different icons to represent materials needed for crafting.
There's also the illustration of the item (stone hatchet).
Gives info on how much the player has discovered & where they can go.
The map itself shows where is land and where is water.
The map is blank until the player discovers the area.
Represents where players (and their teammates) are located on the map.
Level up: up arrow
Inventory Weight
hydration: water drop
Hunger: meat
Energy: Lightning bolt
Health: plus sign
Shows up when there's something the player can do.
Tells players which button on the controller to click for the action.
These types of prompts will always be cyan.

data.data_value: Info on the building being placed

notes: Various car statuses in status bar.
Various icons light up when activated.
Bar moves vertically depending on gas capacity.
Visual indicator of a blocked off path that the player cannot proceed through.
The 'X' shape is a general indicator for no.
Data includes vehicle speed, stats, and tachometer.
Everyone needs to know their speed in the game.
This information is presented here where the players can see each others' health.
This lets them more or less know who is the stronger player.
The round just tells players how far into the game they are, there is no round limit, its just until there's only 1 player left standing.
The text under it is extra resources every player in the match gets for still staying alive in this round.
Items to boost team performance or to one of the heroes stats.
The shop appears periodically as they play a match and it requires coins to purchase.
Sometimes, players can also get items after a round ends.
There's initially a limit on how many heroes you can have on the board.
While this specific vis is independent to the players screen, everyone else can see how many heroes you have based on the opponents tab.

Lets the players know who they're fighting against in this round. The opponent's card will always be on the left side. Tells you the name of the opponent. 2 icons under them is the alliance they have.
The alliance they're using for their heroes, the more they have in this alliance, the stronger their heroes will be.
Whichever player you see in 1a will appear here too. Tells you exactly how many heroes they have on the board, their gold, and overall health.
Quickly differentiate each info with each other, prob more noticeable at a glance first compared to icons.
If heroes use their special ability, a text appears telling the players what skill it is

vis_position.relative_to: individual heroes located on the map

notes: Heroes health, gives a overall view of how each unit is doing, but if players want a more detailed version, it'll be (3)
Calculates the damage that each heroes does in this round of the match.
The scale for the length of the bar depends on the heroes that has most damage.
If the most damage is 313, the range for the bar would be 0-313 and all the length is dependent on that.
When players click on a hero in the field, a card shows up giving them information about the hero. Includes info like their health, stats, special skills, and alliances.
Players can click on any heroes on the field to get info on them.
White glow circle thing

Once a match is over, opponents who lost their individual match will have their names colored, or a text next to them to tell everyone in the match how much health they lost and who exactly won and lost.
Red for the name & red ish overlay for their name card thing. When the health (100) starts going down, the color slowly becomes less green (gradient to become red).
Heroes placed on the field have their icon and star rarity. The star represents their level, more stars = more powerful units. Players can get the stars by merging units together.
Each star also has a different color (bronze, silver, gold).
Each round players will see 5 heroes that they can purchase to add to their board / the bench.
The game will tell the players the heroes options, how much it costs to purchase them, and what alliance they have.
Under the alliance icon, there are the bars to show how selecting & using the heroes will affect the players alliance value thing.
Relates to 1, this lets players quit the shop entirely, refresh the hero options, or upgrade how many heroes they have on the field.
Diff info like how much points you have to purchase heroes (the 27 next to the X).
Increased angle, higher xp value.
Tells players different alliances they've chosen.
Each hero has their own thing and having multiple heroes from 1 alliance can strengthen bonuses for their damage etc.
The more of an alliance the player has, the more bars they have.
Its like more rows?
There is ticks on each bar too since a hero might fill just 1/2 a bar, and some alliances need 3 to fill it instead of just 1.
Detailed view of each player's stats.
The icon shows what their main (up to 2) alliances.
The more of an alliance the player has, the more bars they have.
There are ticks on each bar for partial fills.
If players want to see a detailed view of each players' stats. In this case, it's the heroes they have equipped on the field.
Star under the illust, more stars = more powerful heroes.

If players want to see a detailed view of each player's stats. In this case, it's the heroes the players are benching (ones they're keeping but not playing yet due to space, or waiting to upgrade them or something).
Sometimes after a round is over, players can select 1/3 items offered.
Rarity of the item, purple is tier 4, i think green is tier 1, etc.
The total amount of health the player has plus items they can use to restore it.
The circle indicates the amount of health player has, less filled = less health.
Red means it's the health bar.
Each item has a different illustration depending on how potent the item is.
What key to click to use the item.
Total amount of mana the player + skills the player can use.
The circle indicates the amount of health player has, less filled = less health.
Blue means it's the mana.
Illustration of the different skills the player has.
What key to click to use the skill.
Orange Cross with a dot in the middle represents the player.
Different lines indicate the path and barriers.
Clicking on an item highlights the item.
White outline around the item.
There's also the yellow shiny thing.
Clicking on the minimap will create an overlay of the whole map on the screen.
The diff paths, environment stuff on the map (walls and stuff).
Where the player is located
Orange Cross with a dot in the middle
Helps for differentiation
Different icons of the map to represent points of interest or other players.
Yellow cross for other players.
Blue circle with icon for fast travel.
Helps for differentiation.
Details on what the item is.
Shows up when players is in the same area as a boss and the boss notices them.
Players can click on an enemy to target them. 1b will also appear.
Red outline around the enemy.
Shows up when players click a specific enemy they're fighting.
When players select the method of how they choose their target, a yellow overlay will be added.
Position is at top middle.
Data value refers to selected enemy to target an attack.
When clearing lines, players can then send an attack to a player, this attack will then 'fly' towards the enemy
DATA VALUE: Amount of cleared lines
DATA TYPE: QUANTITATIVE
ENCODING: MARK: Text
CHANNEL 1: Text
POSITION: Middle, position relative to how high the line cleared is
The word 'Tetris' appears when player clears at least 4 lines of blocks
Lets players see which block is coming next so they can properly plan their strategy
This visualization allows players to see general information about their performance in the match, including where they're played, number of opponents killed, and power-ups they acquired.
Shows enemies that are targeting you through a yellow outline around their board.
Says 'watch out' when you are being targeted.
Helps player quickly pinpoint who exactly is doing it.
Lets players see which block they've saved. They can switch the block that's dropping with this block anytime they want.
KO icon shows when an opponent is killed during a match.
Eye icon means they're spectating the game.
Yellow KO icon means those are opponents that were eliminated due to the player's attack.
Greyed out KO icon means that player is out of the game.
When the last opponent standing in the match is defeated, the 'BOOM' graphic shows up.
List of orders players can complete
Details on the order itself. What needs to be in the order & how much time players have to complete it.
Money accumulated from the round
Time left before the round ends.
The bar goes from green to red as time runs out.
The hourglass icon starts to shake when there's less than 30 seconds left.
Text starts flashing red when there's less than 30 seconds left.
Text scales up and down when there's less than 30 seconds left.
When completing an order, the money received shows up.
Fire from the coin
Appears when players have a streak on completing orders
When the order is done / the timer runs out, a color will flash and the order will disappear
Shows up when the thing being cooked is close to burning.
It flashes in and out, gets faster the closer the item is to burning.
Yellow text when its unmapped.
Direction of the current objective (in this case: fuel source)
Side the objective is at
Tells player where they need to go to progress the mission.
The type of mission it is changes the color.
A modal that shows you your current tool, what mode its in, and how much energy capacity in percentage there is.
Different boxes will appear depending on what action you're taking, but sprint energy and jetpack energy is almost constant.
After usage, the line will slowly fill up. When its full, attribute can be used again.
Planet information overlay
Data value: Planet name and temperature
Data type: Planet name: Nominal, Temperature: Quantitative
How much damage they dealt
Tells player direction of a nearby creature.
Red represents.
Different actions one can take in a selectable array of options
Data value is describing the time to process the refining of collected raw material.
Image of resource being processed.
The data visibility is local.
Where is node relative to map
Orient self to know where enemies are compared to office safe room
Becomes green when camera is active
What Night you are on (in this case, nights represent the level or stage you are at, ending at night 5)
Hovering over an entity or item offers an action based on what it is
The mouse tooltip thing
Hovering over an item in from the inventory will pop up some prompts on what players can do + item durability (if applicable)
Crafting Menu for craftable items based on current inventory.
Highlights the area the player is in through FOV, the players exact position, and previously explored parts of the world.
There's an icon for where the player is exactly. Other stuff like places of interest.
Other areas in the map is also darker compared to the area the player is actually at.
High luminance is your FOV. Medium luminance is discovered areas. No luminance is parts of the map that are yet to be discovered.
Expanding the menu lets players see all the possible crafting recipes in a table format.
The diff items in the crafting menu.
What category it is.
Visual of what the item is. If material isn't enough, text is red.
For coop mode, can select so the minimap also shows up.
There's an icon for where the player is & their teammate based on their character (eg. red hair & yellow hair).
Other areas in the map is also darker compared to the area the player is actually at.
Displays a QUANTITATIVE value representing the amount of mana available to use in a given round, and how much is used.
White text overlay displays the total amount of mana, and mana left to use.
Check if cost >= mana
Green hue is used to signify that the card can be played
A subtle pulsing or glowing effect may be used to draw attention to the playable card.
Indicates whether a card is under the effect of summoning sickness, without implying any order or ranking
Green hue is used to distinguish the Zzz symbols from other status effects or UI elements for quick recognition
The Zzz symbols animate by gently floating upwards, reinforcing the concept of drowsiness or inactivity
The type of icon represents the type of special ability a card has.
The Zzz symbols animate by gently floating upwards, reinforcing the concept of drowsiness or inactivity.
The Zzz symbols have a slightly translucent effect fading out.
Displays a QUANTITATIVE value representing the amount of damage inflicted.
White text overlay displays the amount of damage, using a bold font.
Displays whether or not the condition on the card is met.
Yellow hue glow is used to signify that the ability condition on the card is met.
Pops up to teach players new mechanics.
Which button to click.
What action it’ll do.
Pops up when players can get items from a corpse, npcs, or chests.
Illustration of what the item they can pillage is.
What action it’ll do.
Pops up when players enter a new location.
Health bar will briefly appear when players take damage while out of combat.
Pops up when players make a new checkpoint.
Various stats for the player (health, magic, stamina, but can also show how many lives they have etc)
The items that the players have equipped (armour, healing, weapon, etc)
Damage the enemy received
Shows up when encountering enemies in the wild.
The dark yellow thing is the damage it takes, will take away the length of the bar.
Bar itself coloured red.
Enemies can inflict status ailments. If the bar is filled up, whatever effect it does will happen.
Different status effects have different colours for the bar. Eg. Purple --> Poison.
How much money the player has
This type of health bar will appear if players are in a boss battle.
The dark yellow indicates damage taken, reducing the length of the bar.
Bar itself is coloured red.
Lets players trade their item into another thing.
Players can leave messages for other players in various areas. This can be used to give other tips on how to fight a boss, warnings, or just to trick them.
Getting a good rating also gives the author of the message extra health.
Shows player what item they’re holding.
If a weapon, then indicates how much ammo is left (in this case: 7/27).
If its an illegal item, the '!' icon appears.
